title: Data Visualization of Palmer Penguins
text:
Data Visualization of Palmer Penguins
Palmer penguins are fun and we should visualize some of their datas. These are the three different species of Palmer penguins.  image source
Importing packages and reading penguins datasets.

import pandas as pd
import seaborn as sns
from matplotlib import pyplot as plt
url = "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/pic16b-ucla/24W/main/datasets/palmer_penguins.csv"
penguins = pd.read_csv(url)  # accessing the csv and set as a panda dataframe

From the example in this Github page of Palmer Penguins, it looks very intuitive to plot a scatter plot with flipper length and body mass from the data. We can also make the visualization clear using the ‘hue’ arguement to show different color for each datapoint for each species.

sns.scatterplot(penguins, x = 'Body Mass (g)', y = 'Flipper Length (mm)', hue = 'Species').set(title='Flipper Length and Body Mass relationships in three species of penguins')  # plotting a scatterplot with Body mass and Flipper length with different species of penguins. 
plt.legend(bbox_to_anchor=(1, 1),loc=2)  # setting legends outside of the graph for clarity
plt.title('Body Mass and Flipper Length Relationships based on different speicies of penguins')  # title for the graph

Text(0.5, 1.0, 'Body Mass and Flipper Length Relationships based on different speicies of penguins')
